medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain with nausea and vomiting
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours prior to presentation, with diffuse crampy abdominal pain starting at around 7 AM. The pain progressed throughout the day, accompanied by anorexia and mild nausea. Vomiting started around 1 AM, totaling 8 episodes, with initial food content followed by dark yellowish fluid. The pain became more localized to the right lower abdomen, with a normal bowel movement at 5 AM.
